Imogen Redwood
Managing Associate | Connecting the best DevOps & Engineering talent with innovative Payments businesses
Head of Data ⚡Series D Payments FintechRemote - East Coast or EuropeCompetitive Salary + Equity + Bonus!Our client is one of the the fastest growing Payments Fintech, after raising nearly $500k in funding (series D) they are looking to expand their team. A Head of Data to join the organization and drive the vision, strategic priorities, and objectives for our data platform. The individual is responsible for leading the data engineering, data analytics, and data science teams within the organization and would report directly to the CTO.You will: Provide thought leadership and contribute to developing and executing a data strategy and roadmapCollaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions that improve operational efficiency, customer experience, and revenue growthLead and upskill the team in advance data technologies across data engineering, analytics, and data scienceIdentify opportunities to utilize cutting-edge and transformative technologies such as machine learning, natural language processing, automation, big data, and digital enablement to gain a competitive advantagePartner with leaders from various teams across the organization to ensure that new ideas are relevant, evaluated in the right business context and implemented to achieve significant resultsCombine imaginative thinking, persistent problem-solving, business insights, and leadership to advance innovation through dataEnsure data quality, integrity, and availability across the organizationDevelop and maintain data governance policies and procedures You have: 10+ years industry experience Experience working with Data Engineering, Data Analytics and Data Science TeamsYou have led teams larger than 20+ previously, ideally with experience in a start-up environment Proven track record for success in building out best-in-class capabilities at the enterprise level identifying, evaluating, and deploying successful strategies in data and analyticsKnowledge of big data including but not limited to structured/unstructured, real-time/streaming data, external and non-traditional data sourcesCombination of analytical, technical, and business acumenEffective leadership, prioritization, and management of complex deliverable portfolio in a dynamic environmentDemonstrated expertise in tackling complex issues with a track record of implementing innovative analytics/data science solutions and achieving exceptional outcomesTeamwork, interpersonal & relationship-building skills, and ability to lead by influence and exampleIf the above description sounds like you then we’d love to hear from you! Please click on the “Easy Apply” button at the top of this page and follow the instructions to send us your application.Alternatively, feel free to drop an email to imogen.redwood@storm2.com if you prefer.If you do have any extra requirements in order to support your application, then please just add a note along with your CV to let us know.
